Despite the advances of Ukrainian troops on the northeastern and southeastern fronts, a harsh winter is still expected for soldiers and civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear power plant has been disconnected from the power grid

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: after Russian shelling damaged the remaining high-voltage lines, leaving it with just diesel generators, according to the Ukrainian nuclear firm Energoatom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian officials announced that occupation authorities began integrating the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant into the jurisdiction of Russian state nuclear firm Rosatom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now, Zaporizhia is the largest of Ukraine's four nuclear power plants, which together provide about half of the country's electricity. This plant is the largest in Europe and the ninth largest in the world it was captured by Russian forces in the early days of the full-scale invasion in February sitting on the eastern bank of the Dnipro River in an ergo dar in Zaporizhia region the plant is of strategic importance to Russia because it is only about 200 kilometers from Crimea, which Russia annexed in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The plant has six nuclear reactors, and when all of them are online, they can produce enough power to roughly 4 million Ukrainian homes.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Energoatom stated that out of 11,000 people personnel before February, just over six and a half thousand remained here and out of them 100 people have signed new contracts with Russian energy agency Rosatom. Now Ukrainian nuclear firm Energoatom claims that the facility has 15 days worth of fuel to run the generators. And during this time, Russia might try to repair and connect the communication lines to the Russian grid in the direction of the temporarily occupied Crimea and Donbass. There is no more to count. Former right-wing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has the majority needed to form the next government in Israel. With 98% of votes counted, his Likud party would obtain 31 seats and 64 seats for the bloc he supports in a chamber of 120 deputies. The outgoing Prime Minister, the centrist Yair Lapid, has congratulated Netanyahu and has instructed his office to prepare an orderly handover.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After 12 years in power, Netanyahu was ousted last year amid serious allegations of corruption and several open trials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He is expected to return to power backed by the ultra-right and ultra-orthodox parties, and against the backdrop of the worst resurgence of violence between Israeli and Palestinians in the last seven years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He sustained injuries to his leg and was rushed to hospital, and his condition is not believed to be serious, although the condition of the other victims is unknown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The suspected gunman, who was arrested at the scene, told reporters that his intention was to kill Khan because of statements he had made at an earlier rally in Lahore. Khan was traveling from Lahore to Islamabad with a convoy calling for a snap election with little to no security presence.

But the bank painted a grim picture of what's to come, predicting a two-year recession across the country, which would be the longest economic downturn in more than half a century. Countries around the world are struggling to contain inflation, driven by higher energy and food costs due to the war in Ukraine like the Bank of England many other central banks are aggressively raising interest rates in the hope that rising prices don't become entrenched there is uproar in France over accusations of racism in the National Assembly.

sentences.sentence: Giorgia Meloni chose Brussels for her first visit abroad as Italy's new prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She met in rapid succession with the three presidents of the main EU institutions, the European Parliament's Roberto Mezzola, the European Commission's Ursula von der Leyen and the European Council's Charles Michel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The busy afternoon gave her the chance to set Italian priorities at the EU level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She left saying the meetings went well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I wanted to give a signal that Italy wants obviously to participate, cooperate and defend its own national interests within the European dimension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

But these smiles and nice words still have to make it through the next few crucial months.
